intro: Lycianthes lycioides, commonly known as the Mexican nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, peppers, and eggplants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into edible berries, though the fruit is typically not consumed by humans. It is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Lycianthes lycioides is often used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
